poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: What syntax grappled and grammar moved In Burns the numbers mowed like reek That mouthed and bloomed in kinky neon, Mooed across the Firth of Clyde in a paddle-boat steam shriek. Was that a buzzard mewed? A burly barman mused and shone his shots. The stoker mooned and built his mound of dowts. No in the mood. No way to let off steam.
